parts.text: Develop an institutional trading platform with real-time market data feeds, advanced order management systems, comprehensive portfolio tracking, risk controls, regulatory compliance for equities and derivatives, and real-time P&L calculations

Great — this is a substantial system. Please pick one of the branch/language/visibility options in the UI to continue. I recommend starting with Design (Canvas) to capture requirements, entities, and workflows before we build. For a new project, 'New branch — Python — Public' is the fastest path. After you pick, we'll configure the repository and move to the Design step of the Cyoda Journey (Design → Build → Environment → Deploy).

args.question: How would you like to start? Choose branch strategy, language, and repository visibility (this determines the repo template and whether we need your GitHub App installation ID).

options.label: New branch — Python — Public
options.description: Start a new branch from the Python public template (recommended for a fresh project).

options.label: New branch — Python — Private
options.description: Start a new branch in your private Python repo (requires GitHub App install & Installation ID).

options.label: New branch — Java — Public
options.description: Start a new branch from the Java public template (recommended for a fresh project).

options.label: New branch — Java — Private
options.description: Start a new branch in your private Java repo (requires GitHub App install & Installation ID).

options.label: Existing branch — Python — Public
options.description: Use an existing Python branch on a public template repo.

options.label: Existing branch — Python — Private
options.description: Use an existing Python branch in your private repo (requires GitHub App install & Installation ID).

options.label: Existing branch — Java — Public
options.description: Use an existing Java branch on a public template repo.

options.label: Existing branch — Java — Private
options.description: Use an existing Java branch in your private repo (requires GitHub App install & Installation ID).

args.context: This selection decides the repository template and branch strategy. If you choose a private repo, I'll then ask for the repo URL and GitHub App Installation ID and explain the installation steps.
